abstract: In what could be a first step toward restoring confidence in the health of European banks, a panel coordinating stress tests of major institutions said Wednesday that its findings will be disclosed on July 23 and cover institutions representing most of the E.U. banking market.
snippet: In what could be a first step toward restoring confidence in the health of European banks, a panel coordinating stress tests of major institutions said Wednesday that its findings will be disclosed on July 23 and cover institutions representing mo...
lead_paragraph: In what could be a first step toward restoring confidence in the health of European banks, a panel coordinating stress tests of major institutions said Wednesday that its findings would be disclosed on July 23 and cover institutions representing most of the European Union banking market, The New York Times’s Jack Ewing reported.

headline.main: E.U. Stress Tests to Cover 65 Percent of Financial Sector
